sub_title: National Member for Cyprus at Eurojust
summary:
I have 24 years of experience in practicing law, in both the public and the private sector and I have extensive knowledge and experience, in particular, in criminal justice matters, handling litigation, drafting legislation and legal opinions related to EU law.

After concluding my law studies in Greece in 1992, I furthered my education and received my Master in Laws in European Legal Studies and Master in Arts in International Studies from the University of Exeter in the United Kingdom. 

Following my graduation, I worked as a lawyer at a private firm before becoming a Counsel of the Republic at the Law Office of Cyprus in 1997. From 2003, I have been a Legal Adviser and JHA Counsellor in Criminal and Civil law matters at the Permanent Representation of Cyprus to the European Union.

My achievements include:

- Participation in the negotiations for Cyprus’ accession to the European Union (2003)
- Contribution to the drafting of the new Cypriot Constitution and legislation to be put in force in case the Cyprus problem would be resolved under United Nations auspices
- During the Cyprus Presidency of the Council of the EU (2012), I led the justice team and the team of legal advisors, secured the political agreement on the Confiscation and Market Abuse Directives and chaired the PIF and Access to a Lawyer Directives
- Since November 2020, I have been serving as the National Member for Cyprus at Eurojust
